body: If you have data in MS COCO format, you can follow [training](https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch#training) paragraph to train the model. Training on a dataset with different number of keypoints is possible, however you will need to understand and modify the code.

Thank you for replying, I managed to train it on my custom dataset with fewer keypoints but I can't understand the purpose of the "sigmas" array in pose.py.
Thanks again

We use them for tracking persons id in video (between frames), see [here](https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/master/modules/pose.py#L16) and [here](https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/master/modules/pose.py#L64).

Hi @mathblue ,
Have you successfully completed the training and inference on your custom dataset? Could you share steps how to do that? Thank you very much.

Hi, yes I've been able to train that code on any custom dataset modifying
actually few things, I can change the number of keypoints and use Coco
annotator to annotate new images. I don't know why but I didn't always get
excellent results but anyway not bed results.
I'm happy to share the way I did it, I remember that I even wrote a small
tutorial where I explain it. It's quite a lot of time since I worked on
those things but as soon as I'll have a bit of time I'll put the things
together and I'll send you the documentation.

Il giorno sab 6 giu 2020 alle ore 17:28 Thanh (Edward) Nguyen <
notifications@github.com> ha scritto:

> Hi @mathblue <https://github.com/mathblue> ,
> Have you successfully completed the training and inference on your custom
> dataset? Could you share steps how to do that? Thank you very much.

Hi @mathblue ,
Thank you for your time. I am really curious and interested in your work, especially training the model on a subset of keypoints. I am looking forward to your tutorial.

All right, i should have put everything needed to run the code in this repository, I hope the description is clear enough!
https://github.com/mathblue/Custom-Pose-Estimation-Yaw-Roll-Pitch-detection-tensorrt-compilation

Hi @Daniil-Osokin ,
Could you explain a little bit about the `ConvertKeypoints` class?
https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/a52ab66b77f788cf9619857a4956f82c50e276be/datasets/transformations.py#L7

Especially, these two lines:
https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/411ff9fd5f6125e1879cb73f6b4f90090184edad/datasets/transformations.py#L38
and
https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/411ff9fd5f6125e1879cb73f6b4f90090184edad/datasets/transformations.py#L41
I guess `keypoints[5] and keypoints[6]` are not shoulders?

Hi, it converts `keypoints` which contains keypoints in COCO order to `converted_keypoints` in internal order (just remapping and addition of neck keypoint). Shoulders are correspond to the 5th and 6th indices in [original COCO annotation](http://cocodataset.org/#keypoints-eval).

Hi @Daniil-Osokin ,
Thank you. You're right: the COCO order
` "keypoints": ["nose","left_eye","right_eye","left_ear","right_ear","left_shoulder","right_shoulder","left_elbow","right_elbow","left_wrist","right_wrist","left_hip","right_hip","left_knee","right_knee","left_ankle","right_ankle"]`

issue.title: The issue of model output

repository.name: lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch
repository.description: Fast and accurate human pose estimation in PyTorch. Contains implementation of "Real-time 2D Multi-Person Pose Estimation on CPU: Lightweight OpenPose" paper.

issue.body:
Hi, thank you for your excellent work and shared a pre-trained high-quality model.
I am trying to convert a pre-trained model into a TRT model and perform inference.
But the output of the two models is not the same.
```
pth model's output -->
[[1,19,32,32]
[1,19,32,32]
[1,19,32,32]
[1,19,32,32]]
```
```
trt   model's output -->
[(1108992,)
(2217984,)
(1108992,)
(2217984,)]
```
Has anyone done the same before, please give me some help

issue.title: Run demo for custom dataset

repository.name: lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch
repository.description: Fast and accurate human pose estimation in PyTorch. Contains implementation of "Real-time 2D Multi-Person Pose Estimation on CPU: Lightweight OpenPose" paper.

issue.body:
I am running the demo with my custom dataset but it always get the pose entries equaling to 0. Also, for the keypoints.py in modules, just change the kpt list and the paf as the image below. my data is pigs with the keypoint defined as 0 for neck, 1 for ear left, 2 for ear right, 3 for neck, 4 for back, and 5 for tail. Can you help me on running the demo with custom dataset? Thank you. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46335839/101243655-f7fd4e00-3701-11eb-9b6a-b3d2dc3e90a0.png)
